My Treo 600 died — again. This is the third time. I got my first one in March. I went to the PCS store and talked to the same person that waited on me the last time it happened. I asked her what the deal was with these phones. At first she tried to be diplomatic, but after I prodded her a bit, she admitted they have a fairly high failure rate. It's too bad. I really like it and it's great when it works. The combination of a wireless phone, internet access, email and the variety of Palm apps add up to make it a very cool device. I guess as long as they're willing to cheerfully replace it when it dies, I'll stick with it. I don't travel very much, so my exposure is not too high; although it would really suck if it blew up while I was urlLink out of town .
